page.title: 17Local History
page.content: Of the six parishes in this block, five are in Herefordshire, and Suckley is in Worcestershire. Acton Beauchamo was in Worcestershire until the end of last century when county councils were set up and boundaries were rationalised. The two counties have been combined since l974 but local inhabitants still feel loyalty to their former county. Stanford Bishop probably had a Roman settlement and a mediaeval village existed between the church and court. There was also a mediaeval settlement near Acton Beauchamp church. The turnpike road to Malvern from Bromyard bisects the two parishes, houses and cottages were built along the roads and no nucleated settlement survived or developed. In the east of Stanford Bishop lay Wofferwood common which was not enclosed until l862.
